header.tagline: Empowering cybersecurity in public drinking water supply systems
header.description: With the power of AI we identify in real time any anomalous behavior or potential vulnerability in the water supply systems to prevent cyberattacks

graph-neural-networks.title: Graph Neural Networks
graph-neural-networks.description: We provide a tailor-made graph neural network scheme that specifically learns the water flow pattern in public management systems. It can analyze large-scale graph data and identify any anomalous behavior or potential vulnerabilities in the network

data-reliability.title: Data reliability
data-reliability.description: We leverage the power of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to analyze vast amounts of data quickly and accurately

real-time-response.title: Real Time Response
real-time-response.description: By analyzing real-time data from IoT sensors and other sources, Graph Neural Networks can identify the source and scope of a potential attack, enabling a targeted and efficient response

cont-improvement.title: Continuous improvement
cont-improvement.description: By simulating attacks on the network and analyzing the results, Graph Neural Networks can identify the optimal location for sensors and other security measures, improving overall performance while reducing deployment and maintenance costs

risk-management.title: Risk management
risk-management.description: We conduct extensive testing, develop contingency plans in the event of system failure, invest in personal training, comply with relevant regulations and laws, and develop a crisis management plan for legal issues

environment-impact.title: Positive environment impact
environment-impact.description: By measuring flow differences throughout the network, leaks can be detected and corrected, minimizing losses. By digitizing the network, decision centers will receive data in real time, reducing travel, scheduling maintenance more accurately and carrying out corrective actions remotely, thus reducing carbon emissions associated with transportation

step1.title: 1. Data collection and preprocessing
step1.description: Collect historical data on water distribution networks and preprocess the data to remove any inconsistencies and errors. Develop an appropriate database to store the preprocessed data

step2.title: 2. Graph modeling and topology identification
step2.description: Develop GNN algorithms to model the topology of the water distribution network as a graph. Identify the key nodes and edges in the network

step3.title: 3. Normal behavior learning
step3.description: Use historical data to train the GNN algorithms to identify normal behavior in the water distribution network

step4.title: 4. Real-time data analysis
step4.description: Develop GNN algorithms to analyze real-time data from sensors and other sources to identify anomalies that deviate from normal behavior and indicate the presence of a cyberattack

step5.title: 5. Sensor and security measure optimization
step5.description: Use GNN algorithms to simulate attacks on the network and analyze the results to identify the optimal locations for sensors

step6.title: 6. Integration and testing
step6.description: Integrate the GNN algorithms into the water distribution network and test the system in a simulated environment

step7.title: 7. Deployment and maintenance
step7.description: Deploy the system in a real-world environment and provide ongoing maintenance and support
